get.description: This endpoint allows querying the configuration of cross margin symbol.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: If not provided, all cross margin symbol will be queried. If provided, only the specified symbol will be queried.

enableTrading.description: Whether trading is enabled: True for enabled; false for disabled

baseIncrement.description: Quantity increment: The quantity for an order must be a positive integer multiple of this increment. Here, the size refers to the quantity of the base currency for the order. For example, for the ETH-USDT trading pair, if the baseIncrement is 0.0000001, the order quantity can be 1.0000001 but not 1.00000001.

baseMinSize.description: The minimum order quantity required to place an order.

quoteIncrement.description: Quote increment: The funds for a market order must be a positive integer multiple of this increment. The funds refer to the quote currency amount. For example, for the ETH-USDT trading pair, if the quoteIncrement is 0.000001, the amount of USDT for the order can be 3000.000001 but not 3000.0000001.

quoteMinSize.description: The minimum order funds required to place a market order.

baseMaxSize.description: The maximum order size required to place an order.

quoteMaxSize.description: The maximum order funds required to place a market order.

priceIncrement.description:
Price increment: The price of an order must be a positive integer multiple of this increment. For example, for the ETH-USDT trading pair, if the priceIncrement is 0.01, the order price can be 3000.01 but not 3000.001.

Specifies the min. order price as well as the price increment.This also applies to quote currency.

get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint allows querying the configuration of cross margin symbol.

get.description: Request the configure info of the cross margin via this endpoint.

warningDebtRatio.description: The warning debt ratio of the forced liquidation

liqDebtRatio.description: The debt ratio of the forced liquidation

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request the configure info of the cross margin via this endpoint.

get.description: This interface returns leveraged token information.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: ETF Currency: If empty, query all currencies

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface returns leveraged token information.

get.description: This endpoint returns the current Mark price for all margin trading pairs.
get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint returns the current Mark price for all margin trading pairs.

get.description: This endpoint returns the current Mark price for specified margin trading pairs.
get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint returns the current Mark price for specified margin trading pairs.

get.description: This endpoint allows querying the configuration of isolated margin symbol.
get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint allows querying the configuration of isolated margin symbol.

post.description: Place order in the Cross-margin or Isolated-margin trading system. You can place two major types of order: Limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

orderId.description: The unique order ID generated by the trading system, which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

loanApplyId.description: Borrow order ID. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

borrowSize.description: Borrowed amount. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Place order in the Cross-margin or Isolated-margin trading system. You can place two major types of order: Limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

clientOid.description:
Client Order ID: The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user (we recommend using a UUID), and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

side.description: Specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'.

type.description:
Specify if the order is a 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price; you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into these strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

price.description:
Specify price for order

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order.

When **type** is limited, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. The Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

timeInForce.description: [Time in force](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/api-5176570) is a special strategy used during trading

postOnly.description: passive order labels, this is disabled when the order timing strategy is IOC or FOK

hidden.description: [Hidden order](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) or not (not shown in order book)

iceberg.description: Whether or not only visible portions of orders are shown in [Iceberg orders](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146)

visibleSize.description: Maximum visible quantity in iceberg orders

cancelAfter.description: Cancel after n seconds, the order timing strategy is GTT

funds.description: When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

isIsolated.description: True - isolated margin; false - cross margin. Default is false

autoBorrow.description: When Margin Account has inefficient balance, our system autoborrows inefficient assets and opens positions according to the lowest market interest rate.

autoRepay.description: AutoPay allows the return of borrowed assets when you close a position. Our system automatically triggers the repayment and the maximum repayment amount equals to the filled-order amount.

post.description: Order test endpoint: This endpoint’s request and return parameters are identical to the order endpoint, and can be used to verify whether the signature is correct, among other operations. After placing an order, the order will not enter the matching system, and the order cannot be queried.

orderId.description: The unique order ID generated by the trading system, which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

loanApplyId.description: Borrowed amount. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

borrowSize.description: ID of the borrowing response. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Order test endpoint: This endpoint’s request and return parameters are identical to the order endpoint, and can be used to verify whether the signature is correct, among other operations. After placing an order, the order will not enter the matching system, and the order cannot be queried.

clientOid.description:
Client Order ID: The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user (we recommend using a UUID), and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

side.description: Specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'.

type.description:
Specify if the order is a 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price; you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into these strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

Specify price for order

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order.

When **type** is limited, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. The Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

postOnly.description: passive order labels, this is disabled when the order timing strategy is IOC or FOK

hidden.description: [Hidden order](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) or not (not shown in order book)

iceberg.description: Whether or not only visible portions of orders are shown in [Iceberg orders](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146)

visibleSize.description: Maximum visible quantity in iceberg orders

cancelAfter.description: Cancel after n seconds, the order timing strategy is GTT

isIsolated.description: True - isolated margin; false - cross margin. Default is false

autoBorrow.description: When Margin Account has inefficient balance, our system autoborrows inefficient assets and opens positions according to the lowest market interest rate.

delete.description: This endpoint can be used to cancel a margin order by orderId. This endpoint only sends cancellation requests. The results of the requests must be obtained by checking the order status or subscribing to Websocket.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

delete.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to cancel a margin order by orderId. This endpoint only sends cancellation requests. The results of the requests must be obtained by checking the order status or subscribing to Websocket.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to obtain information for a single Margin order using the order ID.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in the Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

id.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

type.description: Specify if the order is a 'limit' order or 'market' order.

feeCurrency.description: Currency used to calculate trading fee

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into these strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

visibleSize.description: Visible size of iceberg order in order book.

cancelAfter.description: A GTT timeInForce that expires in n seconds

clientOid.description: Client Order Id, unique identifier created by the user

cancelExist.description: Whether there is a cancellation record for the order.

inOrderBook.description: Whether to enter the orderbook: True: enter the orderbook; False: do not enter the orderbook

tax.description: Users in some regions have this field

active.description: Order status: true-The status of the order is active; false-The status of the order is done

After the user successfully places an order, the order is in the Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

delete.description: This interface can cancel all open Margin orders by symbol. This endpoint only sends cancellation requests. The results of the requests must be obtained by checking the order status or subscribing to Websocket.

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Transaction type: MARGIN_TRADE - cross margin trade, MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE - isolated margin trade

get.description: This interface can query all Margin symbols that have active orders.

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Cross Margin: MARGIN_TRADE, Isolated Margin: MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE

symbols.description: The symbol that has active orders

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface can query all Margin symbols that have active orders.

get.description: This interface is to obtain all Margin active order lists, and the return value of the active order interface is the paged data of all uncompleted order lists. The returned data is sorted in descending order according to the latest update time of the order.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in the Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Order type: MARGIN_TRADE - cross margin trading order, MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE - isolated margin trading order

id.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

type.description: Specify if the order is a 'limit' order or 'market' order.

feeCurrency.description: Currency used to calculate trading fee

clientOid.description: Client Order Id, unique identifier created by the user

cancelExist.description: Whether there is a cancellation record for the order.

inOrderBook.description: Whether to enter the orderbook: True: enter the orderbook; False: do not enter the orderbook

tax.description: Users in some regions have this field

active.description: Order status: true-The status of the order is active; false-The status of the order is done

After the user successfully places an order, the order is in the Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

get.description: This interface is to obtain all Margin closed order lists, and the return value of the active order interface is the paged data of all uncompleted order lists. The returned data is sorted in descending order according to the latest update time of the order.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in the Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Transaction type: MARGIN_TRADE - cross margin trade, MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE - isolated margin trade

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: Specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify if the order is a 'limit' order or 'market' order.

parameters.name: lastId
parameters.description:
The ID of the last set of data from the previous data batch. By default, the latest information is given.
lastId is used to filter data and paginate. If lastId is not entered, the default is a maximum of 100 returned data items. The return results include lastId, which can be used as a query parameter to look up new data from the next page.

lastId.description:
The ID of the last set of data from the previous data batch. By default, the latest information is given.
lastId is used to filter data and paginate. If lastId is not entered, the default is a maximum of 100 returned data items. The return results include lastId, which can be used as a query parameter to look up new data from the next page.

visibleSize.description: Visible size of iceberg order in order book.

cancelAfter.description: A GTT timeInForce that expires in n seconds

clientOid.description: Client Order Id, unique identifier created by the user

cancelExist.description: Whether there is a cancellation record for the order.

inOrderBook.description: Whether to enter the orderbook: True: enter the orderbook; False: do not enter the orderbook

tax.description: Users in some regions have this field

active.description: Order status: true-The status of the order is active; false-The status of the order is done

get.description: This endpoint can be used to obtain a list of the latest Margin transaction details.  The returned data is sorted in descending order according to the latest update time of the order.

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Trade type: MARGIN_TRADE - cross margin trade, MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE - isolated margin trade

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description:
The unique order id generated by the trading system
(If orderId is specified, please ignore the other query parameters)

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: Specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify if the order is a 'limit' order or 'market' order.

parameters.name: lastId
parameters.description:
The ID of the last set of data from the previous data batch. By default, the latest information is given.
lastId is used to filter data and paginate. If lastId is not entered, the default is a maximum of 100 returned data items. The return results include lastId, which can be used as a query parameter to look up new data from the next page.

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

feeCurrency.description: Currency used to calculate trading fee

stop.description: Take Profit and Stop Loss type, currently HFT does not support the Take Profit and Stop Loss type, so it is empty

tax.description: Users in some regions have this field

taxRate.description: Tax Rate: Users in some regions must query this field

type.description: Specify if the order is a 'limit' order or 'market' order.

lastId.description:
The ID of the last set of data from the previous data batch. By default, the latest information is given.
lastId is used to filter data and paginate. If lastId is not entered, the default is a maximum of 100 returned data items. The return results include lastId, which can be used as a query parameter to look up new data from the next page.

post.description: This API endpoint is used to initiate an application for cross or isolated margin borrowing.
post.x-sdk-method-description: This API endpoint is used to initiate an application for cross or isolated margin borrowing.

symbol.description: symbol, mandatory for isolated margin account

isHf.description: true: high frequency borrowing, false: low frequency borrowing; default false

get.description: This API endpoint is used to get the borrowing orders for cross and isolated margin accounts.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: symbol, mandatory for isolated margin account

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The start and end times are not restricted. If the start time is empty or less than 1680278400000, the default value is set to 1680278400000 (April 1, 2023, 00:00:00)

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: Current query page, with a starting value of 1. Default:1

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default is 50, minimum is 10, maximum is 500

symbol.description: Isolated Margin symbol; empty for cross margin

status.description: PENDING: Processing, SUCCESS: Successful, FAILED: Failed

symbol.description: symbol, mandatory for isolated margin account

leverage.description: New leverage multiplier. Must be greater than 1 and up to two decimal places, and cannot be less than the user's current debt leverage or greater than the system's maximum leverage

get.description: This API endpoint is used to get the information about the currencies available for lending.

increment.description: Increment precision for purchase and redemption

interestIncrement.description: Increment precision for interest; default is 0.0001

autoPurchaseEnable.description: Whether to allow automatic purchase: True: on; false: off

get.description: Request Configure and Risk limit info of the margin via this endpoint.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency: This field is only required for cross margin

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Symbol: This field is only required for isolated margin

borrowMaxAmount.description: CROSS MARGIN RESPONSES, Maximum personal borrow amount. If the platform has no borrowing amount, this value will still be displayed.

buyMaxAmount.description: CROSS MARGIN RESPONSES, Maximum buy amount

holdMaxAmount.description: CROSS MARGIN RESPONSES, Maximum holding amount

precision.description: CROSS MARGIN RESPONSES, Currency precision. The minimum repayment amount of a single transaction should be >= currency precision. For example, the precision of ETH is 8, and the minimum repayment amount is 0.00000001

borrowMinAmount.description: CROSS MARGIN RESPONSES, Minimum personal borrow amount

borrowMinUnit.description: CROSS MARGIN RESPONSES, Minimum unit for borrowing; the borrowed amount must be an integer multiple of this value

borrowEnabled.description: CROSS MARGIN RESPONSES, Whether to support borrowing

baseMaxBorrowAmount.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Base maximum personal borrow amount. If the platform has no borrowing amount, this value will still be displayed.

quoteMaxBorrowAmount.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Quote maximum personal borrow amount. If the platform has no borrowing amount, this value will still be displayed.

baseMaxBuyAmount.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Base maximum buy amount

quoteMaxBuyAmount.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Quote maximum buy amount

baseMaxHoldAmount.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Base maximum holding amount

quoteMaxHoldAmount.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Quote maximum holding amount

basePrecision.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Base currency precision. The minimum repayment amount of a single transaction should be >= currency precision. For example, the precision of ETH is 8, and the minimum repayment amount is 0.00000001

quotePrecision.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Quote currency precision. The minimum repayment amount of a single transaction should be >= currency precision. For example, the precision of ETH is 8, and the minimum repayment amount is 0.00000001

baseBorrowMinAmount.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Base minimum personal borrow amount

quoteBorrowMinAmount.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Quote minimum personal borrow amount

baseBorrowMinUnit.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Base minimum unit for borrowing, the borrowed amount must be an integer multiple of this value

quoteBorrowMinUnit.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Quote minimum unit for borrowing, the borrowed amount must be an integer multiple of this value

baseBorrowEnabled.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Base whether to support borrowing

quoteBorrowEnabled.description: ISOLATED MARGIN RESPONSES, Quote whether to support borrowing

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request Configure and Risk limit info of the margin via this endpoint.

post.description: Place order in the Cross-margin or Isolated-margin trading system. You can place two major types of order: Limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

orderId.description: The unique order ID generated by the trading system, which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

loanApplyId.description: Borrow order ID. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

borrowSize.description: Borrowed amount. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Place order in the Cross-margin or Isolated-margin trading system. You can place two major types of order: Limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

clientOid.description:
Client Order ID: The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user (we recommend using a UUID), and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

side.description: Specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'.

type.description:
Specify if the order is a 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price; you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into four strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

price.description:
Specify price for order

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order.

When **type** is limited, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. The Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

timeInForce.description: [Time in force](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is a special strategy used during trading

postOnly.description: passive order labels, this is disabled when the order timing strategy is IOC or FOK

hidden.description: Hidden or not (not shown in order book)

iceberg.description: Whether or not only visible portions of orders are shown in iceberg orders

visibleSize.description: Maximum visible quantity in iceberg orders

cancelAfter.description: Cancel after n seconds, the order timing strategy is GTT

funds.description: When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

autoBorrow.description: When Margin Account has inefficient balance, our system autoborrows inefficient assets and opens positions according to the lowest market interest rate.

autoRepay.description: AutoPay allows the return of borrowed assets when you close a position. Our system automatically triggers the repayment and the maximum repayment amount equals to the filled-order amount.

marginModel.description: The type of trading, including cross (cross mode) and isolated (isolated mode). It is set at cross by default.

post.description: Order test endpoint: This endpoint’s request and return parameters are identical to the order endpoint, and can be used to verify whether the signature is correct, among other operations. After placing an order, the order will not enter the matching system, and the order cannot be queried.

orderId.description: The unique order ID generated by the trading system, which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

loanApplyId.description: Borrow order ID. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

borrowSize.description: Borrowed amount. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Order test endpoint: This endpoint’s request and return parameters are identical to the order endpoint, and can be used to verify whether the signature is correct, among other operations. After placing an order, the order will not enter the matching system, and the order cannot be queried.

clientOid.description:
Client Order ID: The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user (we recommend using a UUID), and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price; you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.
